text: McJohnston Chapel and Cemetery is a historic chapel and cemetery located in Center Township, Vanderburgh County, Indiana. It was built in 1880, and is a small Gothic Revival style, rectangular red brick building. It has a projecting vestibule topped by a bell tower and steeple. Adjacent to the chapel is the cemetery, with the oldest gravestone dated to 1819. It is the oldest cemetery in Vanderburgh County that remain in use. Note: This includes It was added to the National Register of Historic Places in 1979. ==References== Category:Churches on the National Register of Historic Places in Indiana Category:Cemeteries on the National Register of Historic Places in Indiana Category:Gothic Revival architecture in Indiana Category:Churches completed in 1880 Category:1819 establishments in Indiana Category:Churches in Vanderburgh County, Indiana Category:National Register of Historic Places in Vanderburgh County, Indiana
title: McJohnston Chapel and Cemetery
